reviews_data.review_text: Love this place, amazing coffee and great vibe! The perfect coffee shop to sit down and do some work or just hang out.
Perfect customer service! Cappuccino was on point! The location is so cute and cozy!
No cronuts like they advertise
Excellent specialty coffee. Great for working remote.

Yesterday, I went to The Hobbyist through recommendation of my coworkers. I've heard many great things about this place, and to my surprise, The Hobbyist exceeded my expectations. My friends and I all got the Chai and it was very delicious, probably the best Chai I've ever had. And my friends agreed, it was also the best Chai they've had and we are obsessed! It had a fresh spiced flavor and was pretty sweet - as though they melted a gingerbread cookie into a beverage. Not only that, the vibes are cozy, classy, and very chic. The barista who served our drinks also had a lovely personality: they were friendly and very funny! Now whenever someone asks where I can find the best Chai, I will immediately say The Hobbyist!!!

I used to like this place. Coffee was so so not amazing for the price of a simple iced coffee. I typically go after the dentist but today the shop felt dreary and a bit empty than usual. As for the quality of my coffee it felt over bitter and tasted a bit old. Would I recommend this place? I guess it depends, hopefully next time the coffee quality and atmosphere will improve.
Traveling from Colorado, this place is awesome for coffee or bakery goods. A very reasonable price. My friends had beer and loved it. You have to visit here.
Great atmosphere and delicious food and drinks. Will definitely be back.
It's dope
Great local spot, excellent coffee and locally sourced pastries, and an extensive wine and beer selection  Very welcoming staff, and pleasant laid back atmosphere, my new go-to hangout in Charlotte!

Tried their mocha latte, it was pretty good what made the experience even better was the service and how helpful the barista was (wish I got her name she was truly amazing) and the sitting areas. There is parking in the back with plenty of space as well as street parking on the left side of the plaza.
People of color are not welcomed here. I wish I had the strength to go into detail about my experience but I don't.
Great atmosphere and amazing Coffee.
They make a great Cortado here and often have Friends on tv.  Can't go wrong with that!
Love this place! The selection is awesome and I love the ambience!

This place was absolutely amazing. We were traveling and stopping through but are big coffee shop people. We loved everything from the ambience, the view, and the staff. What a great experience as we were in Charlotte for only a couple days. Will be coming back if we're in town again

Was recommended this as a place for good beer while I do some work on my computer. Got there to signs saying no laptops, so that's a no go, I guess? Judging from some other reviews I just read, this seems to be a common complaint. Bad policy imo.
The Baristas are passionate about coffee. We really enjoyed our visit here.

I've been going to The Hobbyist for a couple years now. It's always been one of my favorite coffee shops + bottle shops in Charlotte, and in general! It always has an amazing beer and wine selection. The coffee is delicious. I would typically put five stars for it, but the recent "Hobbyist unplugged" has really dropped the quality of the shop for me.  I never write bad reviews, because I am a service worker (barista + server) and know the heartache they can cause for a lot of people! I am genuinely writing this review because I love this shop and am sad to love it less. I also want to point out this review is not about the baristas, the drink quality or shop quality, but I feel like this is important for anyone considering going to get work done on weekends.  I went into the shop tonight, excited to get some work done over a couple beers! I walked in, saw the signs on the bar, saying no laptops! I completely understood. (They used to have a rule about laptops on the bar during busy times! I respected it!) But then I looked around and saw the signs on every table. I had already ordered my beer and I asked the employee if I'd not be able to do work, and he said no, there are no laptops allowed right now. I even asked about outside tables and was told it wasn't allowed.  I understand the balance between bar and coffee shop! However, I was one of four customers in the shop at that time. I was there to spend some money, work on my laptop, and leave by the closing time. If it was busy and I was taking up valuable space of people who may drink more, I would understand. However, it was empty, so I just didn't understand the point. I quickly drank the beer he already poured, and went home.  A review before mine, mentioned how they didn't advertise this enough, but then someone responded saying there are signs on the door. However, unless you follow the shop on social media, this is not clear anywhere else. And if you're someone googling a place to get some work done, The Hobbyist still comes up on weekends. Getting your things together, and going out of your way to try to go to one of the only places open past 8 that is (was) good place to work, and then finding out you can't, kinda sucks (especially when it's empty).  As someone who has gone to the Hobbyist countless times, ordering beer, wine, or sometimes coffee/tea, I am just sad to see the time I spend there cut significantly because of this new policy.

stopped by the other evening to have a drink and a snack while getting some writing done. all the baristas were incredibly helpful, kind, and attentive, the pastries were to-die-for, and both the iced tea and the hot chocolate I ordered were spectacular! definitely will be coming back here more often!
Waited over 30 minutes for coffee because they dropped during the handoff between cashier and barista.

No WiFi Friday-Sunday, their policy. No indication of this policy, yet the WiFi guest password is displayed. Place is great, I just like policies that affect the guest experience upfront and with consistency. Make the password flyer double-sided. So when Friday-Sunday comes around you can flip it over to say ‚Äúweekend event-no internet. Enjoy.‚Äù
Coffee good Vibes good Seasonal drinks good
They take way to long to make drinks. If you order an iced latte expect it to take at least 15 minutes. Also the employees act like your interrupting them when you order.

I visited this location a month or so ago for the first time, it started off fairly bleh‚Ä¶ There was a barista who was pretty short tempered with me. I didn't know where to check out, and she got angry about it and rushed me when I inserted my card. She didn't ask me if I needed assistance nor did she give me the to-go cup I requested when I purchased a chai tea. Anyways, things got progressively better when the young African American woman entered. She was more polite and asked if I needed anything, and was pleasant to be around as I sat and worked on my laptop. Soon the first girl left and it was even better when the three gentlemen entered. Had the best tasting Caramel Macchiato, and the customer service was much better from them. The experience got better and plus the shop doubles as a brewery too! So that was pretty cool! It's a good place to go within the area when out on a date or visiting the NoDa area.

Been here twice, both TO-GO visits. I was greeted warmly each time. I consider myself a coffee guy so I notice certain aspects: - They serve drinks at the right proportions, not huge 16oz lattes and 14oz cappuccinos. - Always a fan of coffee shops that make their own syrups. Drinks aren't overly sweet a.la Starbucks. (the entire purpose of going to a small coffee shop imo). - Even when To-Go, barista still took the time to put an appropriate design in my latte. Don't know his name but the taller white guy. 9.3/10 (still need to sit in).

I don't care to leave reviews but I'm going to start because wow this place was overhyped! Below average lattes. I've never actually been to a coffee shop that can't make a good caramel latte because of this place, now I have! They only have Black Walnut, Lavender Vanilla, Vanilla, and Caramel flavors despite what google reviews showed and don't sell cronuts anymore which we were most excited for. The limited menu wouldn't bother me if the menu they did have was good. I'd recommend Undercurrent Coffee or Not Just Coffee instead.
Amazing atmosphere, and great spot for working and short conversations. I tried the half sweet honey bee flat white and it was just balanced!
Alice is great! üèÉüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü¶ñ

Great coffee. Awesome vibe. Should definetly checking out if you are in the area. Try the black walnut latte. Grab a few craft beers while your at it!! Owner was super cool too. Sat and chatted for a while.
Chill vibe with good Coffee!

This is a forewarning for anyone looking to study or work on the weekends. This is also not a review of the staff, the beverages, or the ambiance, but I felt like this was an important message. I went to prepare for the work week on Sunday afternoon and found the tables riddled with small "No Laptop" signs on the tables. At the time, my initial thinking was that the establishment did not want computers on the furniture (because the alternative, banning them completely, seemed absured given that I regularly worked at The Hobbyist this summer. Shortly after getting my tea did one of the employees let me know about their new "unplug policy" on the weekends to give patrons a chance to connect with one another in person (although, when I looked around, the policy didn't seem to be efficacious). On the weekends, I sometimes need to get out of the house and complete work in a neutral space with other people who are similar in that regard, but I feel that this recent policy overplays its hand and falls short of the intended goals. Restricting patron's autonomy and choice in the entire space detracts from the neutrality of what I feel a coffee shop represents.

Had a latte and flat white. Large and spread out space with lots of seating, love the decor/vibe.  Coffee was pretty good but 2 criticisms would be milk was a tad overheated and espresso a little harsh. It did mellow out eventually and finish nicely.  Overall nice shop but for me plaza midwood undercurrent is still reigning champ.

I walked in after my visit to the dentist and decided to get a draft from the bar. There were 1-2 people in line to get coffee drinks. Which the three staff members were seemingly busy with tending to their drinks. There were also two other customers at the bar who had been served already. None of the staff seemed to care that I had entered the establishment and sat at the bar, didn't  even look my way. I entered the place through the front door. They were moving slowly as if they had time to kill. At one point the woman employee sat back for a quick break and didn't even bother to look over to see if needed anything. At this point I had been waiting there about ten minutes. I like this place and expect a higher level of customer service. I reluctantly decided to leave.
üëç
The place is amazing üòç the coffee was soooo good , the Banana bread was delicious üëçüèª
You'll always find a friendly staff. A great place to grab a coffee/ beer and work or just hang out.

They stay so busy! I went on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed. That's definitely an amazing thing. They had a great selection of coffee options and wine/beer. I enjoyed their seasonal Black Walnut Latte and it was really tasty.

This is my favorite coffee/wine shop in Charlotte. The vibes are giving with the greenery and the antiques!  The coffee is quality and they are very serious about their craft. The wine and beer offerings are also always spot on and the staff take the time to help me find the perfect picks! The General Manager also stepped aside to show me around the wine and I was very thankful!  Overall 10/10 ‚ù§Ô∏è
Live music on Fridays is awesome.
amazing selection of teas!! and the interior is so beautiful

Amazing atmosphere, clean and nice bathrooms, great public wifi. Love their caffeinated and wine/beer menus alike. I always go by for their sour fridge area to try new local brews. I like how there is 4 areas for seating/working. Near the back entrance, bar seating with TVs, near the front entrance, and outside on the patio. Lastly it's great location for anyone coming off the Greenway / parkway just south

The Hobbyist has what many cafes lack these days. They have an understanding of their espresso pulls and the art of making a drink to give you a beautifully presented beverage with the right flavor as well. I had a few of their selection. The chai latte is exactly what a chai latte should be. It didn't taste overly sweet like many do and the different spices and herbs of the chai were present and clear. Their espresso was also wonderful. I'm not usually someone who enjoys just straight espresso but I suppose I do when it is done right. The Hobbyist does it right. The live band in the background also helped add to the experience. Very pleased.

Great coffee, cool place and the staff is always super nice and helpful with great suggestions! My favorite coffee place in Charlotte. The black walnut iced latte with oat milk is AMAZING and is my go to there.
Great place to sit in the afternoon for a drink and to get some evening work in.  Some of the best beer prices in the area, quality wine selection.
Great Coffee and good vibes‚Ä¶ even the other customers are friendly which says a lot about the establishment
The staff is great but decaf coffee seems to be an afterthought here. Due to health reasons I have to cut my caffeine intake and the shop doesn't seem to keep a consistent stock.
I went here yesterday with my buddy Josh.  I loved their Black Walnut Latte.  I drank 2 of them.  I had a hot and an ice.  It was perfectly made!

I want to like this place but I've had hilariously bad service all three times I've gone here. I asked if the savory croissant had any meat in it and was told ‚Äúthere's no way for them to know because they didn't make it in the house‚Äù. Friend asked for her scone while we waited for our coffee ‚Äúit's just really busy we will give it to you with the coffee.‚Äù It was not really busy and there were 3 people working behind the counter. Every interaction that I've had with people that work here they've been strangely rude.

The Hobbyist is so cute, the coffee is great, and they have a really nice selection of beer/wine/sake/CBD products. I love going there Friday nights for live music, and the people working there are incredibly friendly. This was one of the first places I tried when I moved to Charlotte and I've gone back several times!
I got an Americano with Vanilla, it was a very nice and strong coffee.

Decent coffee, and great staff. Its open late so that's the main reason I go here. The only issues are every Friday night they have bands come it, which are extremely loud and sometimes not very good. Its hard to use this coffee shop like a coffee shop when you cant talk to the person next to you or study. Additionally, they have a big garage door in the front, which they keep open way too much, when its very hot and very cold. The owners don't give the workers the authority to close it, even when the weather is terrible.  Reply: Thank you for your reply... wasn't looking for PR response though... Just letting the general public know what the shop is like. The back area consists of a couch and 3 chairs, when there's a band or the doors are open, those get filled VERY quickly. I've asked about the windows, and been told that the owner watches the employees over the video camera's, and makes them keep the doors open even when they and/or customers want them closed.
Great experience. Very busy though, we were there during their morning rush. They handled it well though!! Fun staff, very in the know, and lots of delicious things to try. I'll definitely go back!!
This place continues to be my favorite coffee shop I have tried here in Charlotte so far.
My favourite place to get coffee in all of Charlotte.  Great staff, great coffee, great atmosphere
Fun place to meet friends or just sit quietly reading a book or reflecting on life in Charlotte!

I went to the Hobbyist this morning and was blown away by the skill and hospitality of the Barista's.  The overall service was amazing! It was truly a grand example of what third wave coffee should be! I ordered one of their signature lattes (Toasted Sage & Fig) it was spot on. The flavors blended perfectly with the espresso!  They have pastries delivered from a local bakery down the street too (which I think is amazing since they don't have a kitchen in house)  The atmosphere is stunning. You can tell that whoever designed the space carefully curated the antiques and plants with intention! They have plenty of seating but from what I could see it was filling up fast.  This is now my new favorite specialty coffee spot in Charlotte! Way to go Hobbyist!!!!!

Other than being told that I will be charged for water in a to-go cup despite being a paid customer, this is a cool spot to get some work done. Seating is comfortable with power outlets widely available! The drinks are good and they have a decent wine selection.
Good vibes, tons of space and a coffee bar to sit at. Very comfy place.. The cinnamon bun was good but need a tad bit more frosting. Loved it all..

Great coffee! The cronut we had was to die for. The chill vibes of this place make me wish I had a reason to stay and hang out with my laptop to study/work. Alas I'm not that cool... so I just sit with my coffee and pretend to look productive.

Typically I love going to The Hobbyist to knock out some work and grab a coffee, but I'm no longer continuing to go there and/or feel welcome. My girlfriend and I went Sunday afternoon to get some work done before the week. She only wanted a water to start out, and we were told by a worker, Jonathan, that if we didn't order anything more than water we would be asked to leave. It was odd considering that he walked straight up to us individually and said that. We go pretty frequently, always order food and drinks, drop a good amount of money there on a weekly basis, and occasionally buy bottles of wine. It was definitely a very disrespectful event to come across, and I have never really come across something like that before. We will definitely be buying our coffee and wine elsewhere just due to that one individual staff member.
Great coffee and super yummy cronut

The most stunning decor with a truly wonderful staff. In the day and age of COVID/severe staffing issues, the Hobbyist runs a seamless operation that offers outstanding service and exceptional products. Cheers to their dedication to quality and commitment to top tier service in unprecedented times.
Ordered 2 iced coffee, waited 27 mins. Very very understaff or may be they are just slow? Not not worth the experience.

Recently found this gem in NoDa. I was inquiring for a bottle of wine I had been searching for locally. Unable to find it on the shelf, I ask one of the employees behind the coffee bar. She tried to find it with me on the shelf, but no luck. She went in to the back of the store, only to come back with the bottle I had been searching for. SCORE !!!!  Very pleased with the helpful staff and cool atmosphere. Will be frequenting here again soon.
Probably the slowest servers I've ever encountered
Such a pleasant place to be. Drinks are so enjoyable and the physical space is great. Grab a bottle of wine or a six pack of brews on your way out.
Yummy iced matcha latte, fantastic cronuts, friendly staff, unique enviornment.
Great Latte flavors and presentation, hope they open a good breakfast menu too. Soothing place to hangout with friends.

Love the idea of a coffee bar that also doubles as a chill spot with draft beers! The Hobbyist also had cooled beer that can buy to drink there or make four packs to go. Did I mention wine that they can uncork for you? It has couches and tables, as well as an actual bar. You can stay as little as long as you'd like. The coffee was delicious, and I loved all the drinking options! Will def be returning.

Place has a great vibe to it and smells great when you walk in. It took 20 minutes to get a latte though. To long for a coffee shop. If you're in a rush to grab coffee and run I don't recommend. The coffee was great though.

Nice place but takes forever to get a latte made. I would have ordered drip coffee if I thought I'd have to wait 15 minutes for a latte. The food was good and the ambiance was nice  but not worth the wait if you're in a rush.
Cute bottle shop and friendly staff. They customized an order for me, which was great!
Good vibe and coffee. Excellent bottle selection

You gotta know the good cafe from the first step by the great smell of coffee. And that's what you can experience at the Hobbyist. The coffee is absolutely good! real taste of espresso if you're looking for. However it was a bit time taking precess for two cups of cappuccino in not a very busy day. The location is kinda in a remote area.

Fabulous espresso, beer and wine place. Their espresso, latte, and cortado are among the best in Charlotte for sure. Their beer and wine selection is also very broad. The staff are very nice, and the place has an elegant but relaxed atmosphere that is very cool. Highly recommended üëåüèΩ

Nice spot to meet up with a friend for coffee. I was there on a Saturday morning. A lot of seating available. I also bought some beer and wine to go. I had the cold brew and it was good. Overall a cute spot!
Nice place for a coffee and conversation. They have options for bottled wine and beer. Along with draft beer. Would recommend this for a quick stop at NoDa.
Amazing atmosphere, awesome spot to work, have a date, read, or hang with friends. Incredible beer, wine and coffee selection.

Cool little hipster joing on N. Davidson St in NoDa.  When you walk in, your senses are celebrated with beautifully roasted coffee.  A bar to the right, a fridge full of beer to the left.  Wine and more beer up ahead.  Tables and chairs.  People on laptops drinking coffee and/or beer.  Very nice taplist.  This go around I ordered an IPA and the fill was PERFECT.  Up to the rim.  My beertender slowly walked my order to the bar, making sure not to spill a drop.  Well done, Beertender.  While enjoying my tasty beverage, I perused the beer fridges.  I found a rare bottle you don't normally find in this area and set it on the bar to take home.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  We cracked some jokes, had some laughs and I was off.  Thanks Hobbyist!
First time visiting The Hobbyist, what an awesome space, great coffee and chilled atmosphere and the sound system and music dang, I stayed and had another drink. Keep it up, perfect.
hot choc da bamb
Best Coffee Joint in Charlotte AND!!!!! Outstanding Bartender and Barista Service!!! Boo Yah Ka Shah!!!!
Great selection of beer but the girl behind the bar knew nothing about the beer. Weird.
Great atmosphere and beer selection. Very friendly staff. Will definitely visit again.
Such a cute coffee spot! The staff are always friendly & welcoming. The vibe of this place just feels good. Love the coffee & pastries, especially the kronuts. Yum!
Just discovered this gem! Definitely will come back soon
Prefect place with your friends or to work
The interior designer did an awesome job with this place. This is a great place for a casual meeting or just to enjoy an expresso and chill.

What a cool place! Stopped by before brunch for some coffee. We ordered a drip coffee and the honey bee flat white (hot, oat milk). The music inside was very loud, lots of punk rock tunes. It made for an interesting vibe, but I have no complaints. I want to go back to try their pastries or their bottles of beers/wines. They got pretty busy but the staff was friendly! Lots of seating options available, parking spots in the back too. It's so cool that they have plants and other little merchandise items for sale. Definitely want to return next time I'm in Charlotte.
Elite taplist and can selection

I was very pleasantly surprised :) Aside from a nice atmosphere, lots of seating and great staff, there's also a wide selection of wines, including Japanese sake brands. I enjoyed my afternoon here for sure.  (Be aware that they are currently requesting masks for entry. But that's neither here nor there)
Great coffee, definitely has some interesting choices in their alcohol section.
The waitress is very professional and friendly, she opened a new bag of coffee for me just to ensure the freshness of the coffee!
Always a nice atmosphere and good selection of different types of beers and wines. Great coffee and kombucha as well. A spot i like to go and hang out and relax. Board games there as well
Great service.
My Black Walnut latte was great
Love the atmosphere, coffee, and the staff. Anytime I go to grab some coffee I always feel welcomed!
Was visiting Charlotte and hit this place almost every day.  Cool place to get a good cup of coffee or a pint of beer.

We spent a long weekend in Charlotte and visited the Hobbyist every day we were there. Really good coffee, fun beer and wine selection, local snacks, live music, beautiful space - we wish we had a Hobbyist near our house! Really enjoyed all the time we spent there
Nice atmosphere, great service.... I only had tea here.
Really chill place, love the vibe and atmosphere. Will go there again. I ordered the peppermint tea and it was great. Service was great too
Wonderful Americana coffee and the kronuts are to die for.

I love this place. The environment, the staff, the coffee, everything is just great. It's become my go-to place to work at. The baristas are super friendly and its just a a great place. I could not speak any better about this establishment. If you're in Charlotte or live here, this is the place to be.
Nice chill spot to grab a coffee, tea or beer. Employees were very nice and respectful. Will return soon.
Great Cozy Ambiance. Clean facilities and friendly staff!
Very relaxing and a nice place to  conversate with good friends
The place has a great vibe. The coffee as very good. Nice place to hang out with friends or get some work done.
A new favorite! From the chill yet playful playlist, great customer service, cute decor, and yummy drinks. Quite aesthetically pleasing; a vibe to visit for sure.
Awesome little neighborhood shop! Has a little bit of everything.

I love the coffee at this place and have been coming for over a year! I typically use the Odeko app to order and it's proven to be very unreliable. Today I ordered a coffee through Odeko that was quoted to be ready in 10 minutes and it wasn't ready after 30 minutes. I had to leave without the coffee due to an appointment. I sent an email to Management regarding a refund.  Update: owner reached out and ensured a refund was issued and apologized. Thank you!

Something I always look for in a coffee shop is good atmosphere, and this place has it. Super cool place inside with some awesome seating. Only downside is the seating is very limited. There are tables outside but if you going during a busy time it can be crowded. Coffee & tea are both great and the display is wonderful to. Shop also has a decent selection of wine bottles and beer for sale to take home.
Awesome experience great beverage menu hot or cold ....non alcohol/ alcohol

One of the more "Hip"  coffee places I've had the pleasure of visiting. Everything in this place screams we take our coffee and drinks very seriously. I literally watched them weigh each part of my iced latte, from the cup with ice to milk to the shot of espresso; quite impressive. And with all that effort, my coffee was top notch, just the right balance of coffee bitterness and creamy whole milk.  They also have a huge selection of wine and beer, and good sampling of options on tap. This place is definitely an upscale, get relaxing spot to have a coffee or a drink, whether you're trying to get some work done or just meeting a friend. I'll definitely be back!

Spectacular coffee - we were in Charlotte for a quick two day trip and the coffee was so good that we went back on day two to try out more of their menu! Very nice service, and we were able to relax on one of their couches with our toddler for a while while we enjoyed our coffee. Highly recommend!

I really want to love this place. The environment is great, the coffee is great.  I order through the app almost every weekend, but literally every weekend it takes over an hour to get the coffee and it's cold or warm. The last two weekends this has happened where my coffees have just been behind the counter when my name wasn't called or anything. After an hour I'd get them. I hope we can be friends  Again love the place and the coffee when it's hot, but for some reason I can't get it to work right.
Coffee was bitter, but people and scenery were great
They have great prices and the beer  Selections are amazing
Great espresso beverages, staff was super-friendly, and a great space to hang/work in. Highly recommend this place!

Some of the best curated taps in town, always tons of something new and interesting, great can cider and wine selection, friendly staff, sorry for staying till last call but you have a great evening vibe.

Absolutely love the environment and variety of coffee selections. The only thing I wish they would have is more edible options with bread/croissants included. I love that they have plants, wine, and lots of other cool things you can purchase to take home! I would come here just to buy wine if I'm looking for a good wine shop.
Overpriced and bakery items are old
If you like coffee and alcohol this is thr place to go. There's no shame in getting a coffee in the morning and your drinks for later. Plus with the wide variety of options, you can't just go once!
First time here, wonderful vibe, will be back.
Chill atmosphere,  good beer selection and kind, knowledgeable staff.

Very nice chill place. Outdoor seating and also indoor with tables and chairs or if you're feeling the lounge vibe they have couches. Super friendly staff. I tried their walnut latte with oat milk and it was amazing!!!! Also had one of their sakes and that was delicious as well. Totally coming back.
Love love The Hobbyist to grab great beer!!! The owners Bryson and Julie know what's going on in the beer and wine market these days! They have their finger on the pulse, if you wish to say.
Amazing space and great choices of beverage.  Staff was wonderful.  We had a great experience.  Highly recommend to all!
Excellent
I hope this place to be located in front of my place to go everyday
Perfect coffee shop !
Love their coffee! Wish there were more food options but their latte is incredible.
Really great coffee and aesthetic with parking in the back. Highly recommend
Both of the drinks that we ordered tasted good, but were not hot.  Will definitely try them again and adjust it was a one-off thing.
Pretty cool place, baristas are friendly and they make a great coffee, also there is some food options.
Excellent coffee, wonderful atmosphere.
Wonderful team of professionals. They were fun and full of energy. They even let me sing as I walked to the door. They all seem to be a true blessing.

Excellent coffee and beer shop.  Good bean selection,  spacious inside and small outside area.  Great selection on craft beer, coffee,  and other fridge items. Very sweet staff,  warm atmosphere,  and can't wait to come back! We loved the bean packaging too!
Great latte art, nice atmosphere, and bonus points for a decent craft beer selection.

The best coffee shop I've been to while traveling!! This is the smoothest cold brew you will ever enjoy. It's absolutely amazing. All the good coffee shop vibes are there, also lots of plants and a bar/wine selection. Would love to go back when passing through Charlotte again!

Great atmosphere with exceptional staff. Have a lot of great selections on tap and serve some of the best coffee in Charlotte. Nice place to hang out and get some drinks and pastries. Go check it out if you get a chance!
Great atmosphere. One of the only coffee shops open for seating. I got a dirty chai and it was delicious

Coffee and beers? What can go wrong with that combination?  If you love this combo this is your corner... @thehobbyistclt has the best selection of beers you'll find along with some delicious coffee.  About this corner: Attention is excellent, service is great, and the ambiance allows you to get real comfortable
Nice service fun atmosphere
A nice place with a cozy atmosphere and some good coffee.
Been there couple of times. I like the place and the decorations. I'm a big fan of chai latte, they make delicious chai latte. Would highly recommend.

Service. Service. Service.  I went to a cafe down the street and decided to go somewhere else to sit down after the lack of quality service. I came to The Hobbyist and felt right at home. The man behind the counter had the sweetest disposition. He was genuinely excited about everything I wanted to order. After having his recommendation for tea, I decided to grab a couple to-go beers because I appreciated the staff so much.
Very good coffee
Very cool place to hang out/work or grab a bottle to take home. The coffee is top notch too

HUGE fan of this place and can't believe I failed to give them 5 stars until now.  It will forever hold a special place in my heart because my husband and I would take our newborn there every Friday evening until COVID hit.  But we are back to going pretty regularly now, and it's definitely one of our top few places to go in Charlotte.  The staff is so friendly, the croissants are incredible (and sustained me through my pregnancy), and they have a great beer and wine selection.  And the ambiance is so lovely.  My kind of place for sure.
Loved loved LOVED THIS SPOT!

Hip atmosphere serving Hatchet Coffee which is roasted in Boone, NC. I tried the cappuccino with macadamia milk and the pourover. Both were good. They have a huge and unique selection and beer, cider, and wine of all sorts,

Strongly adheres to NC.Gov mandates. Very cool spot. Staff is friendly and effective during a rush. Coffee and drinks are high quality. Loads of options for craft beers and ciders. Prices are reasonable for canned drinks and bottled wines. It would be helpful to have some sort of organization between IPAs, Ciders, Sours, etc. If you really like ciders but can't find them, you're less likely to purchase them.
This place is great. Have beer and wine, the coffee is fantastic, and the service was great. If you dine in, they put your coffee in real cups with metal straws, which is a nice touch.
Very friendly staff, Wonderful wine and beer selection. Great lattes!
My new Fave spot!!! The team is so chill and awesome!!!! Plus they have beer and wine
I'm usually here for the cronuts they stock. They are always fresh and fantastic! The lattes are yummy too. Good beer and wine selection.
Best cappuccino I've had in a while. Cool place to spend the Saturday mornings with friends. Super clean place. Highly recommended!!
Grab a coffee or a beer and chat with friends or get some work done. The vibe here is awesome. Then buy some beer or wine and take it back! Love this place
Always a good spot for an afternoon drink. Friendly staff and great atmosphere
Can selection is pretty good, bottle selection (for beer) not so much. Service was ok but the price for the canned beer was pretty steep 30 dollars for a 4 pack is kinda really high.
Always satisfied with my coffee every time I do get a chance to stop by.
the coffee was delicious and the ambiance is unbeatable! love this place
Definitely a huge fan of this place! Such a nice and friendly atmosphere, love the live music and the coffee is one of the best I've had in the city. Would recommend 100%
The locals drink and eat here and aroma of coffee causes instant craving for a cup..
Currently enjoying a (Local) Honey Turmeric Latte with Macadamia Nut milk. DELICIOUS! Love this place. I just wish there was more seating!
Cool spot, very friendly
Coolest coffee shop around. They have vegan options and lots of beer. I've never been to a place quite like it.

Very good bean at this location, I thoroughly enjoy coming here to grab a latte. Espresso is top notch as well. Lots of selection and usually pretty quick. Order on Odeko ahead of time if you're in a hurry.
A lovely place and a pleasant atmosphere. However, the espresso is extremely acidic.
Amazing coffee & vibe!!!!!
Love the atmosphere and the staff is great! If you're sour fan try the self unaware it's top notch!
Amazing beer selection

8/12/2020 Stopped here to try something new in NoDa. This place has a great atmosphere and the coffee is delicious.  I ordered a Latte and their vegan banana and chocolate chip bread.  Total was $9.47 plus a tip.  The banana bread was incredibly delicious and tasted freshly made!  They have a big assortment of wines and beers which I plan on coming back to take a closer look at.  They have seating inside, outside, and a bar.  Definitely worth a stop!

Immediately the vibe of this spot will capture you but just wait. Order a coffee and prepare yourself for an incredible cup any way you'd like it. They rotate coffee varietals from some of the coolest roasters in the Carolinas. After you catch your coffee buzz settle in for some perfectly procured craft beer and wine. They have a nice selection of the hottest trends and classic staples. This is the perfect spot to work away from home or catch up with an old friend. If you haven't been you're missing out.
Awesome speciality lattes! Great curbside service with Cloosiv.
Great vibe with friendly and helpful service. I loved the menu - there is definitely something for everyone.

Awesome place with friendly, knowledgeable staff. Top notch coffee, beer and wine (both to enjoy there or to-go) with a relaxed yet sophisticated vibe.  It's the kind of place you'd be comfortable hanging out for a long time - morning, noon or night.

I stop by multiple times a week and I always get great service. Staff does a great job at genuinely making conversation when I sit inside as well. Glad to see they're doing well even after everything going on with COVID.  I highly recommend their great beer selection.
Such a fun place to spend time. Beautiful on the inside!
If you are looking for consistently AWESOME coffee with even more consistently awesome vibes in the Queen City look no further! Did I mention their beer and wine selection slays?

as a first timer, i was captivated by the charm of the decor and decided to settle in for a flat white. it was strong, bold, smooth and creamy. i loved every sip. there's plenty of seating and an excellent wine selection. i love this place!!

A great place to grab a large selection of craft beers from across NC. Resident Culture, New Anthem, Haw River, Burial, and more! Has coffee, and a wide selection of other goods like plants and bakery items. Parking can be a little tough, but it's a definite spot to try in Noda!
Cans and coffee :)

It's a fun shop in a fun area. They sell coffee, tea, and pastries as well as beer, Mead, and wine for here and to go. I had the best matha lemonade I've ever had. They made the lemonade fresh on the spot which really gives it that extra touch.

I have visited three times so far and I'm sure this will become a staple for me. My business partner and I like to choose local businesses to patronize to discuss ideas for our startup. The Hobbyist is perfect! Lots of spaces to chat, the environment fuels creativity and the quiche is amazing.  I'm not a huge coffee connoisseur as most times I'm happy with Dunkin' (don't judge me) so the coffee was tasty enough for me.  As others mentioned, there is a lot to choose from including Kombucha, beer and wine. I'm not a drinker so I cannot speak to those selections.  The staff is always super friendly. It's usually busy but not overly loud and they have live music on Friday and Saturday nights. Their merch is cute too.
This place has many of my favorite things: coffee, beer, wine and atmosphere.  Well done!

This place is my love. I moved to Charlotte like 8 months ago & recently I got to know that The Hobbyist was just opened like 1-2 months prior to my move to Charlotte. Quality of coffee/ tea drinks is outstanding. The staff & owners are above & beyond lovely. The sense of community is always flowing in its air. The staff is super caring & friendly. Selection of their beers & wines is super professional. Friday & Saturday nights live music always bring extra extra cool vibe into it too.

I had the Vanilla and Lavender Latte, which is served with real Lavender leaves which brings it to the next level.  Extremely friendly staff, live music and cozy seating make for an enjoyable experience.  I highly recommend.

What a cute place. Lots of cozy places to sit and good coffee and things to eat. Also wine I just recommend I get a bigger oven that they use to reheat foods It's a tiny little thing and takes about 10 minutes to get what you ordered out of the pastry case. Great find in NoDa
Going to Hobbyist is my latest hobby. Their specialty lattes are really creative and delicious. Baristas are very pleasant and the lighting is also really nice to hang with a friend or do some work.
Totally liked this new coffee/ beer shop. A new fav

I have been coming to The Hobbyist almost weekly since July 2019 and it's by far one of my favorite spots in Charlotte. The staff is so welcoming both morning and evening with great selections! I love getting my house-made latte flavors from Alice and Patricia then returning in the evenings to Rachel and Zach servin' them beers! An overall wonderful atmosphere that I find myself spending hours in!

Pleasant environment and great beer offerings. The shop will turn into a live music venue at night and the atmosphere is relaxed and enjoyable. In the morning, they offer good coffee and tea. The place is clean and chic, except they have a door issue with their restroom. Don't know why it takes them so long to fix it.
We love coming here ,very friendly and fun environment ,we love the saturday night music and specialty beer and wines.
Severely underrated place. Great beer selection. Great coffee. Great interior decor and vibes. Very clean. I like the location. A favorite of my lady's.
Great coffee. I just had a latte. They have a good atmosphere. Even the bathrooms were nice.
Great place to spend time with friends or study for the upcoming exam.

Delicious beer and wine offerings! The coffee is creative with a  rotating seasonal menu. All of their latte syrups are made in house including the Mocha syrup! They use Counter Culture as thier roaster and source all the milk from a local creamery.  The service is excellent! The owners are usually there and are not afraid to help you pick out beer/wine or even just chat about life. (Something you don't see a lot of these days tbh) The Baristas/Bartenders are also great and very helpful if you don't know much about coffee etc.  They also have free live music on the weekends!  Overall it's a beautiful shop and a lovely environment.  Th ,  They

Order: Fall Latte, Rice Krispie, Chocolate Truffle Price: $13 Positives: Super cool space (especially if you like drinking), they have a small sampling of lots of different stuff (wine, beer, coffee, food), their chocolate truffle was killer Negatives: The coffee itself was pretty weak, seems like it might be a better place to drink than get coffee tldr: Purely from a coffee perspective, the Hobbyist is ok. It's definitely not bad, but I feel like they might suffer from trying to do so much that they don't really specialize at any of them. If your looking for a place to drink though this whole review doesn't really apply since we only went there for the coffee.  Thoughts: my wife and I were driving up to Virginia to see some friends and spend the night in Charlotte. We did some pre-scouting for coffee shops and decided the Hobbyist would be one of the places we stopped in. I wasn't quite expecting how diverse the Hobbyist is when I first came in the door. They sell food, they have a very large beer and wine selection, they have beers on tap, and then almost in a separate area they have a full coffee bar. Now, in my experience when a place tries to do too much at once it can often end up doing all of it well but maybe not the best. Regardless, we decided to try one of their seasonal fall lattes and one of their chocolate truffles. The barista also convinced us to try a rice crispy treat because she said it would be the best rice crispy treat we've ever eaten.  It took a couple minutes to grab our coffee and we poked around the shop to find that they have a wide variety of things for sale. They serve food, sell candles, dog treats salads, sandwiches, all sorts of stuff. And it did seem like a pretty cool place to hang out or maybe get a little bit of reading done in their back study nook area. We were looking to pick up our stuff to go as we also need to go grab dinner that night, so the reading nook remained unused.  Once the coffee arrived we grabbed the rice crispy treat and headed out the door. The barista was right with the rice crispy treat, to her credit. It was the best rice crispy treat I've ever had; but...it was still just a rice crispy treat. It was still just sugar, in this case brown sugar, marshmallows and rice crispy's. If you're not a huge fan of rice crispy treats this thing isn't going to blow your mind. If you are you'll probably love it!  Unfortunately the latte was honestly super week. I could taste that there was coffee in it but it definitely didn't give me that little bit of bite that a good espresso does. The flavor was there I just think I would have doubled or tripled the amount of espresso in it, or maybe just served it with a lot less milk. Either way it wasn't something I really enjoyed. The truffle on the other hand was fantastic. Very creamy super dark chocolate he fantastic little treat, if only I had some really strong coffee to drink it with.  I think that this place honestly just has a lot going on. I really don't want to say that they have too much going on, but it feels like that a little bit. As I mentioned earlier, I have no idea if this is a great place to hang out and drink beer because my review is solely focused on the coffee portion. That being said, I probably wouldn't be here just to drink coffee very often.

Best hidden gem in the middle of NoDa. Relaxing atmosphere where you can unwind with extensive craft beer selections, good priced wine, and coffee that will warm your soul. Its a one stop shop for beverages, stop in and you will see why I go here multiple times a week. See you there! Cheers!
One of the nicest coffee shops in CLT. My sister loves this place.
Great atmosphere and a delicious drip coffee. Excited to try their extensive beer menu next time.
Great place.  Chill location for a beer, wine or for some coffee.  Beer selection is top notch.

Decent coffee. Good beer. Rated 2 stars because the atmosphere looks like an empty warehouse and the barista that made my latte was very unpleasant... believe her name was Alice or Allie... She should not be working in customer service with an attitude like that. I explained my latte was WAY too sweet and she refused to remake it. I asked for a refund so she finally ended up remaking it. Still was not very good.
They are so nice there and always goes out of their way to make me feel comfortable.
Atmosphere. This place is destined to be a charlotte hotspot

Wonderful atmosphere, and I was thrilled to see they have parking in back.  :). Very cool vibe...great water dispensary (nice option at no charge or can buy bottled water) and coffee options galore.  They serve some food/pastries, but not a full kitchen service. Overall great impression, and comfy seating situated well so not too loud.

The staff is just SO friendly. There are so many "hip" coffee places in CLT and a lot of the time the staff at a lot of these places can send off vibes that just seem a bit arrogant. The hobbyist's staff is just the opposite of that. Super welcoming and friendly. Plus they serve oat milk and it's pretty inside. Def a good spot
Hip, good coffee
Love this place. Great coffee, great beers on tap, great bottle selection, and great atmosphere!

Good prices and fun atmosphere. Prices are fair and the coffee and beer selection is great. Some of the servers will even put pictures in your beer which is a great unique way to put a smile on your face.

This eclectic coffee shop is so much more than that - it's got wine, beer, mimosas and more! The staff is attentive and friendly and I felt very welcomed here throughout my visit. There are deli snacks and items for purchase in case you are hungry, and there's a special on mimosas on Sundays..what more do you need?
Always great coffee, great ambiance, great music. Love this place
The Hobbyist has great coffee and a great vibe. I love the frequently alternating taps and the fabulous  wine!  My wife loved the grapefruit spritzer! We can't wait to come back!
Spilled half my drink on accident and they ran over and grabbed me a whole new one! I'd highly recommend this place :)
Great atmosphere and the fact you have coffee, wine, and a killer beer selection available is perfect. Go check these guys out! Amazing spot.
Just discovered this wonderful new coffee shop. Great coffee and great service. Owners were very friendly and seating was nice. Support local business!

The coffee was on point with a caramel syrup that is house made and not too sweet. Also the place has a clean hipster chic with good seating throughout though a large group would probably have to sit outside. This was my second time visiting and I'll probably come again!

You are 150% MISSING OUT if you haven't visited this cozy, modern coffee/wine haven in Noda. The Bar is perfect during the day for getting work done & meeting amazing people.  The staff here is INCREDIBLE. Never in my life have I met baristas as friendly & warm as these girls! Coffee is delicious (and the matcha was even better! no added sugar in this matcha!!!)  They have a very impressive wine & beer selection, tons of local and unique brands.  I will be coming back and bringing friends! Make sure you visit this shop!!!!!
Really cool place. Great selection. The bottle shop isn't huge, but very diverse and interesting to browse. The coffee is excellent and the beer selection is very good.
Great bar in the NoDa area with good beer selection and coffee. You should really check it out.
Really good beer on tap
Nice and mellow
Great staff, amazing service and best wine selection in the city.

Yay! It's finally open! Was at the Pho place a coupled months ago and my friend and I walked over to be nosy and I think the wife of owner or another lady actually took the time out to drop what she was doing (setting up) and chat with me. So excited that this is less then 5 minute walk from my house and it's in Villa Heights! Not Noda! I'm a coffee connoisseur and can't wait to stop by and try their menu.  To the folks giving low ratings- give them a break- starting a small biz is no joke. They are trying And I'm sure in time this place will be packed!! Much luck to the owners and I definitely support small biz especially having one of my own. Cheers! :)
Great cronuts

So happy to have The Hobbyist in a 2 minute walk from my house! I have been dreaming of this day for many years...a place to walk to in Villa Heights with awesome coffee and snacks that also serves as a great place to meet friends or visit with family on a lazy weekend morning. Early hours and awesome vibe. They delivered my dreams and more! Not only do they have really tasty coffee, they also have matcha and specialty drinks, as well as a roomy bar set up with beer and wine.  Super nice owners too!
Great spot to read and chill out
Had a really nice experience there.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  Beer selection out of the tap was unique.  Lots of selections in the coolers. Worth a visit if you are a beer connoisseur.
Great coffee and service!

Highly recommend this place! Came here for the first time for coffee and desert after a disappointing experience at a nearby deli (I won't name names) and the atmosphere, vibe, and friendly service completely lifted my mood! I could see myself spending significant time hanging out and working here; a rustic/industrial vibe with tons of cool tables, booths, and nooks. Plenty of outlets to plug in your electronics. The coffee is excellent and smooth. They make all of their syrups in house. And we tried a Torsades which was a twisted chocolate croissant with sea salt. Delicious on all accounts! So many more things I'd like to try here. Patricia was super helpful in giving us the run down for our first time here. I really dig this place and I think you will too! - Adam from Appetite + Adventure @appetiteandadventure

Been here a few times now, and though it lacks the eccentric feel I normally go for in a coffee shop, my experiences have been pretty solid. The staff has always been friendly and helpful, and the coffee is amazing. Please note that this isn't Starbucks, so when you order a coffee, latte, cappuccino, etc. it may take time. I know the one lady can do latte art and it was neat watching her.  The clientele is super yuppie/uppity and often lacks diversity, but that is no fault of the stores, just the location. Do your thing if you are alone and you'll be fine. The setup is awesome if you get to work from home or often have projects you would like to tackle on your laptop as there is plenty of seating and plugs virtually everywhere.  Their beer selection is pretty solid when you consider the multitude of coolers/book shelves with various crafts local and abroad.
Love this place. Always something happening.

Minimalist coffee and bottle shop located in Noda. Plenty of space and seating options (outdoor available as well). Friendly staff. Syrups made in-house. Latte was a tad foamy but tasted great. Overall, neat new addition to the CLT coffee scene.

Great coffee/cafe beverages and options... Whether it's decaf espresso, liquid sugar-in-the-raw to mix into a cold beverage, or an oat milk alternative, many more options on cafe drinks than Amelie's, although not quite as large of a pastry selection. About $6 gets you a mocha latte made with oat milk and I'm not sure if I've ever tasted one better.
Pretty nice little shop. Friendly staff. Cold brew was smooth and tasty. Very reasonably priced. Lots of comfy seats to lounge and work from.

An adorable little shop on the edge of an upcoming area in NoDa. They serve an excellent selection of coffees, beers, and wines along side delicate pastries and treats. The owners are awesome and the staff is pretty great too. Very friendly and knowledgeable about what they do. It's refreshing to see a shop like this with a modern twist on an old classic. I will be back for a long time coming.
I love this place. Good coffee, slick decor (which is kinda lacking in NoDa) patisseries, wine and craft beer. It's a grown up version of Noda/Villa Heights.
Great place..good selection of craft beers..great decor

Such a gem in the NoDa area. I'm a big coffee enthusiast and I like heading into shops to get work done. Great ambiance and the music isn't overpowering (which is huge in case I need to listen to videos).  Love this place!

Disappointing customer service. Came in on a Wednesday night to meet friends and have a drink. With only around 12 beers on tap, we wanted to see what was in the fridge. There are 4 fridges in a L shape. Bryson, the owner, was helping a guy who was literally reading the title of every beer and asking if it was good. We tried to grab a beer out of the cooler and got elbowed out. We waited over 2 minutes and kept being ignored. Tried again to say ‚Äúexcuse me‚Äù politely and try to grab the beer we wanted from the case, but we were physically boxed out. When we are were finally able to access the cooler, we had to wait to be checked out because Bryson continued to chat with the customer and ignored us, who were trying to check out. We lived in the neighborhood and we're excited to support a new local business - won't spend our money after that experience.
Great beer and wine selection. Coffee and pastries were amazing, too. The owners were extremely friendly, along with all that worked there. Nice, warm inviting atmosphere. Will be back soon!

Ordered a Matcha Latte and it was amazing! I'm usually pretty picky with my order but they blew me away. Also the inside of the shop is gorgeous!! Just left a few hours ago and I already can't wait to go back!
Cool atmosphere, great staff. Nice place to chill and get wine/tea/coffee/dessert.
This place is amazing. Awesome decor. Great selection of beer, wine, pastries and coffee. Everyone was super friendly. Highly recommend

This place is such a great addition to Noda! Their house wine and Prosecco on draft are amazing. The chai lattes (with almond milk) are delightful, and their baked goods are super yummy. The decor and overall vibe are warm and welcoming. Great place to work or to swing by after hours for a glass of wine.
